definition: simple/uncomplicated/letter/to choose/to select/bamboo strips used for writing (old)
history/annals/title of an official historian in ancient China
"A Brief History of Time" by Stephen Hawking

sentences.english: That's a simple history of taxes.
In this paper the history of Chinese auto-industry and total materialconsumption are reviewed.
sentences.chinese: 本文回顧了我國汽車工業發展簡史和用料總量。

sentences.english: The Paper introduces the brief developing history of Hoechst Celanese Corp. and its standard & specialty grades of acetal copolymer.
sentences.chinese: 公司發展簡史和共聚甲醛的標準品級以及特殊品級。

sentences.english: A brief history of the Society of Scientific Age is narrated in this paper.
sentences.chinese: 本文敘述了科學時代社的簡史。

sentences.english: The latest album of Li Jianhong, "The Brief History of Time" is released by Post-concrete Records, U. S.
sentences.chinese: 李劍鴻最新專輯《時間簡史》由美國廠牌後具象發行。

sentences.english: Here is a brief history of their quest
sentences.chinese: 如下是他們的探索簡史。

sentences.english: is best known for his book A Brief History of Time.
sentences.chinese: 霍金教授因其《時間簡史》一書而名揚四海。

sentences.english: A brief history of the prophets might clear this point.
sentences.chinese: 我們看看衆先知和使者的簡史，自然能找到答案。

sentences.english: Sowell likes history, but he likes it on Post-it notes.
sentences.chinese: 索厄爾喜歡歷史，可他僅僅喜歡便利貼似的簡史。

sentences.english: A short history of some of the better - known CIA Cold War covert operations.
sentences.chinese: 中情局在冷戰中，某些最知名之祕密活動簡史。

sentences.english: That is about as brief a history of computers as anyone can make it.
sentences.chinese: 每個人都能寫這樣一部計算機簡史。

definition: to run a newspaper/to publish a newspaper
to break a code/to crack a riddle/to solve an enigma/a breakthrough
